Home > Stories > ECOncrete

ECOncrete - the concrete that saves the world ocean

Let me ask you a question. Which is the world’s second most consumed material? If you answered

concrete, you are right. Concrete is great for building. It is cheap and easy to make. But the sad fact is

that concrete is terrible for the ocean

So if you look into places where there is concrete in the water, you will see that the marine life is

suffering. The fish is no longer around, the oysters and corals are disappearing and the concrete is

lifeless for decades.

That is where Dr. Shimrit Perkol-Finkel and Dr. Ido Sella, two marine biologists, come in to solve one

of the hardest problems. They spent the majority of their lives researching, studying, diving and

learning about the oceans. After many, many years, they came up with an amazing technology. They

designed a new unique unit, built with new added materials. It is designed with tiny holes for the

small fish to live in them. It is ecofriendly and it is even stronger than normal concrete.

When you put this new concrete in the water for months, the most amazing thing happens! Small

fish live around it, seaweed grow on top of it, corals and oysters appear around it and marine live

thrives. And all of this brings the concrete to live.

An interesting thing is that when biology grows on the concrete it actually makes the concrete

stronger. This is called bio protection.

Lifeless oceans could turn into an amazing eco-system for humans and the animals alike. That is why

these guys are designing ports, breakwaters, seabeds and seawalls that are built with the ocean in

mind. It is not just beautiful. It is also good for the environment and for the concrete. Concrete is not

a “sexy” problem and solving it can be tough, expensive, challenging and takes decades. However, so

far, Ido and Shimrit installed their concrete in five different countries, in five different waters and the

results are amazing. They cast it and design it and it is placed in Brooklyn Bridge Park in New York

video for them, how do this new concrete bring life, Ido said that it do it by retaining water at low

tide, it creates hot-spots for biology. It is the design, the material and the composition of the surface

that makes all the difference.

When Ido and Shimrit install millions more of these concrete blocks around the oceans they will

change the world one block at a time.

You can visit ECOncrete's webside and also the Youtube channel of Nuseir Yassin who made this video.
